RESEARCH COMMITTEE — This committee advises the President and Board on all
matters pertaining to research in the educational broadcasting field; provides
leadership in defining research needs and in suggesting research programs for
meeting these needs; seeks to stimulate and encourage significant research
activities wherever they may be located; coordinates the research activities
of the association and its committees; fosters research information exchange;
conducts research seminars when feasible; and serves in a consultative capac¬
ity for research aspects of the projects of the association, its committees,
or its members. (Revised February I960)
TV PLANNING COMMITTEE — This committee, formed in 1959, was a consolidation
of the former TV Development, TV Management and TV Programming Committees.
Its responsibilities were outlined by then-President William Harley as follows:
”This committee will have as its primary function advising the President and
Board of Directors on activities and projects the Association should undertake
in the field of television and assign priorities and indicate emphases. The
committee will work with the Finance Committee (Note - Functions now assumed
by Development Committee) on long-range planning, purpose and develop new pro¬
jects in the television area, provide counsel on NASB's posture toward and
relationships with other organizations active in television, and, in general,
co-ordinate the many varied activities of the Association in the field of edu¬
cational television.” With the steady progress toward inter-connected live
networks in TV, this committee will carry out appropriate studies and advise on
steps it believes the NAEB should take, with appropriate co-operation with other
organizations In the field, when indicated* With the increased number of legis¬
lative and FCC proposals and develcaments, this committee will, when possible,
be called upon to investigate and act vise the TV Board, the NAEB legal counsel,
and the President on positions to be taken by the NAEB in various relationships
and presentations. It will also, seek to ascertain, however possible (including
consultation with other TV committees) additional needed services in both closed
and open circuit television, and recommend means of providing them. (This
definition is subject for further revision and refinement by the NAEB TV Board,
to which it serves as an advisory and idea-suggesting group. It has been sug¬
gested that this committee should meet whenever possible in conjunction with.
Center affiliate meetings of Station lianagers, at the IERT, and NAEB Conventions.)
UTILIZATION COMMITTEE — This committee, created in 1957, was in part in recog¬
nition of a need which had already become increasingly evident in the NAEB, and.
in part the result of the AERT-NAEB merger. This committee is divided into RadxO
and Television Subcommittees. It is responsible for recommending to the Presi¬
dent and the Board proposed activities in the area of utilization of radio and
television broadcasts for educational purposes and for suggesting ways of imple¬
menting those activities. When feasible the committee conducts service projects
and arranges seminars and meetings designed to improve utilization practices.
